summary: Nice but it doesn't allow resizing the window vertically

description: Clean and simple, i liked the design. But i spent around 4 minutes to create my first list. It was difficult because of the suggestions that you putted such as "for the next 7 day". Again, the design is top, just keep improving my guy!
summary: Nice design but hard to understand simple functionalities

description: A very nice looking app. Although still work in progress, it looks very promising.

This is the application that Linux and GNOME needs right now, a great task manager. There's still a lot of room for improvement, but it's really good as it is right now. I'm always paying attention to this project, because it's something that the Linux/GNOME ecosystem really needs (Endeavour is good but it crashes like crazy). Thanks devs for your awesome work.
An absolutely gorgeous app which is a pleasure to use and keeps me productive!

I have lists called "today", "this week", "this month", "next month". When I re-priotize an item, e.g. I won't do it this week, but this month, I now have to delete it in the "this week" list and create a new item in the "this month" list. That is too cumbersome, so unfortunately (since the rest looks very nice) I cannot use it...
summary: Cannot move / drag an item to another list

description:
Thank you fo making this app.
Between simple To-Do list/Task Listing apps, it's one of the bests. Still Errands is better in my opinion, even though that it has less features in some ways.
Just works how you would expect it. Really nice small todo program.

La aplicación es excelente (me recuerda a task.org en android); sin embargo no permite la sincronización, o exportar los datos. Sería útil poder sincronizar (por ejemplo, con CalDAV, DecSync); eso la haría mi app de notas ideal para linux.
summary: Buena, pero no permite sincronización o respaldo de los datos

description: Es buena, muy manual o mecanica, pero cumple con el objetivo de llevar el control de las actividades que uno valla agregndo
